page.title: 14Ravenfield Ponds
page.content: The{Phoenix (B.S.C.) Social Club}now owns{62 acres of ponds}and land. There are three ponds in a curve, 2 of them probably made before the 16 century the 3rd one added much later in a {delightful wooded valley.}The valley is used for the{fishing club}and for {walking.}There are the some old coach {roads}and{pathways}running through and {2 streams}enter on the eastern end which were dammed to form the ponds. Excavations are going on to uncover {ancient weirs}and other stonework. Firsby {reservoir}overflows into this valley and there are{100yrs old brick- {built conduits}buried deeply to take the extra water. On the south side a steam enters the pond. It is locally known as the{Lions mouth}or{Sweet {Well,}but is now{polluted.}There are many varieties of trees and flowers on the steep valley sides.
